title.narrative: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING & MDCP

description.narrative: Improved national and sub-national capacities to systematically collect, analyze and use disaggregated data and other forms of information to monitor, inform policy decisions, and report on the situation of children and child poverty in all of its dimension, using an equity-based approach., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid), Research, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national systems and policies are effectively addressing multiple deprivations affecting the most vulnerable boys and girls across the lifecycle, and building their resilience, through adequately funded social investments and rights-based quality social policies on the basis of adequately disaggregated data on children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved national and sub-national capacities to systematically collect, analyze and use disaggregated data and other forms ofinformation to monitor, inform policy decisions, and report on the situation of children and child poverty in all of its dimension,using an equity-based approach.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s new strategic programme development has been informed by evidence generated from the last Multi Country Programme, sectoral programmes on the situation of young people in the subregion and the Office’s performance in implementing the Child Friendly Schools/Effective Schools and Humanitarian Cash Transfer programmes. Decisionmakers and Programme managers accessed accurate and updated information on children situation in the Turks and Caicos Islands as the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS) was released in 2021. UNICEF and countries&39; response to emergencies are better managed in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines and Trinidad and Tobago through the establishment of real-time monitoring systems. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:14/01/2022
